arm_group.description: parents counseling guided by the experiment protocol

brief_summary.textblock:
It is presumed that families of poorly controlled diabetic adolescents (type 1) would
      benefit from parents' counselling, guided by "the New Authority" model.

clinical_study.brief_title: Applying the "New Authority" Model in the Treatment of Poorly Controlled Diabetic Adolescents and Their Families

detailed_description.textblock:
"The New Authority" model has been shown to be helpful in risk behaviors such as children's
      violence and school refusal. It is assumed the model would prove helpful in the risk
      behavior of lack of adherence to diabetes treatment regimen. The treatment is give to
      parents only, without the adolescent's participation. It is predicted to improve self care,
      parents' monitoring, family conflict and parents' helplessness.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  diagnosis of diabetes type 1

          -  condition duration a year or more

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  family does not speak Hebrew

          -  adolescent doesn't live at home

          -  serious psychiatric condition in the family

clinical_study.official_title: Development and Assessment of a Treatment Protocol for Poorly Controlled Diabetic (Type 1) Adolescents, Based on "The New Authority" Model

primary_outcome.measure: change in self monitoring of blood glucose
primary_outcome.time_frame: assessment at 4 points: enrty, after 3 months, after 6 months and after 9 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessment at four points: entry, after 3 months, after 6 months and after 9 months
assessment at four points: entry, after 3 months, after 6 months and after 9 months
